snippet: A federal jury awarded $23.1 million on Wednesday to a 22-year-old black man who was unarmed when he was shot and paralyzed by a sheriff’s deputy, but Florida lawmakers will have to approve any award above $200,000.
abstract: Federal jury in Florida awards Dontrell Stephens $23.1 million, saying his civil rights were violated in 2013 when he was shot and paralyzed by sheriff's deputy Sgt Adams Lin while unarmed; state lawmakers must approve award before it can be paid.
lead_paragraph: A federal jury awarded $23.1 million on Wednesday to a 22-year-old black man who was unarmed when he was shot and paralyzed by a sheriff’s deputy, but Florida lawmakers will have to approve any award above $200,000.

headline.main: Florida: Man Shot by Deputy Is Awarded $23 Million
headline.print_headline: Florida: Man Shot by Deputy Is Awarded $23 Million
